contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had an adverse reaction to a vaccine component.

contraindication.observationTitle: Severe allergic reaction after previous dose of RSV vaccine
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the patient has had a severe allergic reaction after a previous dose of RSV vaccine.

contraindication.observationTitle: Birth mother received RSV vaccine during pregnancy
contraindication.contraindicationText: Do not vaccinate if the birth mother received RSV vaccine during pregnancy.
contraindication.contraindicationGuidance: The infant should not receive a monoclonal antibody younger than 8 months unless the pregnant mother received an RSV vaccine and encountered one of the following issues. The dose was administered in the incorrect route/site, was of lower than recommended volume, was administered before 24 weeks gestation, was administered less than 14 days before birth, was not the Pfizer/Abrysvo product, had preparation errors prior to administration, or had storage issues.

seriesAdminGuidance: Except in rare circumstances, a monoclonal antibody is not needed for most infants younger than age 8 months who are born 14 or more days after their mother received Pfizer/Abrysvo RSV vaccine.

The infant should receive a monoclonal antibody younger than 8 months if the pregnant woman received an RSV vaccine, but encountered any one of the following issues. The dose was administered in the incorrect route/site, was of lower than recommended volume, was administered before 24 weeks gestation, was not the Pfizer/Abrysvo product, had preparation errors prior to administration, or had storage issues.
RSVPreF3 (GSK, Arexvy), RSVpreF (Pfizer, Abrysvo), and mRNA-1345 (Moderna, Mresvia)  vaccines are not licensed for infants and young children.

RSV, mAb, nirsevimab-alip, 1.0 mL, neonate to 24 months

RSV, bivalent, protein subunit RSVpreF, diluent reconstituted, 0.5 mL, PF
Respiratory syncytial virus (RSV) vaccine, unspecified
RSV, mRNA, injectable, PF

seriesAdminGuidance: Except in rare circumstances, a monoclonal antibody is not needed for most infants younger than age 8 months who are born 14 or more days after their mother received Pfizer/Abrysvo RSV vaccine.

The infant should receive a monoclonal antibody younger than 8 months if the pregnant woman received an RSV vaccine, but encountered any one of the following issues. The dose was administered in the incorrect route/site, was of lower than recommended volume, was administered before 24 weeks gestation, was not the Pfizer/Abrysvo product, had preparation errors prior to administration, or had storage issues.

ACIP recommends 1 dose of nirsevimab (200 mg, administered as two 100 mg injections given at the same time at different injection sites) for infants and children aged 8-19 months who are at increased risk for severe RSV disease and entering their second RSV season
RSVPreF3 (GSK, Arexvy), RSVpreF (Pfizer, Abrysvo), and mRNA-1345 (Moderna, Mresvia)  vaccines are not licensed for infants and young children.

indication.description: Administer to persons who have chronic lung disease
indication.guidance: Children with chronic lung disease of prematurity who required medical support (chronic corticosteroid therapy, diuretic therapy, or supplemental oxygen) any time during the 6-month period before the start of the second RSV season

indication.description: Administer to persons with cystic fibrosis
indication.guidance: Children with cystic fibrosis who have either manifestations of severe lung disease (previous hospitalization for pulmonary exacerbation in the first year of life or abnormalities on chest imaging that persist when stable) or weight-for-length less than the 10th percentile

indication.description: Administer to American Indian or Alaskan Native persons
Administer to persons with severe immunocompromise

set.setDescription: Dose is not needed if the patient is under 8 months of age
Dose is not needed if patient is 8 months or older and received a dose under 8 months this season.

condition.conditionType: Vaccine Count by Date and Age

set.setDescription: Dose is not needed if the patient is under 8 months of age
Second 100 mg injection is not needed if patient is 8 months or older and the first 100 mg injection was not administered.

seriesAdminGuidance: Either maternal RSV vaccination with Pfizer/Abrysvo or use of a monoclonal antibody in the infant is recommended to prevent RSV lower respiratory tract infection, but administration of both products is not needed for most infants. At this time, a pregnant woman who receives Abrysvo during one pregnancy is not recommended to receive Abrysvo during a subsequent pregnancy. ACIP will make decisions concerning revaccination as more data become available.
RSVPreF3 (GSK, Arexvy) is licensed for adults 50 years and older. mRNA-1345 (Moderna, Mresvia) is licensed for adults 60 years and older. These vaccines are not licensed for pregnant women.

The infant should receive a monoclonal antibody younger than 8 months if the pregnant woman received an RSV vaccine, but encountered any one of the following issues. The dose was administered in the incorrect route/site, was of lower than recommended volume, was administered before 24 weeks gestation, was not the Pfizer/Abrysvo product, had preparation errors prior to administration, or had storage issues.

indication.description: Administer to persons who are pregnant.
indication.guidance: Pregnant women should receive 1 dose of RSVpreF (Pfizer, Abrysvo) vaccine during 32 through 36 weeks gestation starting 1-2 months prior to the anticipated beginning of the RSV season and ending 1-2 months prior to the anticipated end of the season. RSVpreF vaccine (Abrysvo, Pfizer) is currently approved and recommended for administration as a single dose. Sufficient evidence does not exist at this time to determine the need for additional doses in subsequent pregnancies.

set.setDescription: Dose is not recommended to be repeated if Arexvy or Mresvia were administered.

seriesAdminGuidance: CDC recommends a single dose of RSV vaccine for persons with other chronic medical conditions or risk factors that a healthcare provider determines would increase the risk of severe disease due to respiratory infection, including from respiratory syncytial virus (e.g., frailty, situations in which healthcare providers have concern for presence of undiagnosed chronic medical conditions, residence in a remote or rural community where transportation of patients with severe RSV disease for escalation of medical care is challenging)

observationCode.text: Recipient of a hematopoietic stem cell transplant

indication.description: Administer to recipients of a hematopoietic stem cell transplant [HSCT] within 2 years of successful transplantation.
Administer to persons who have chronic liver disease.
Administer to persons who have chronic heart disease.
indication.guidance: Includes congestive heart failure and cardiomyopathies, excluding isolated hypertension

indication.description: Administer to persons who have chronic lung disease.
indication.guidance: Includes chronic obstructive pulmonary disease [COPD], emphysema, asthma, interstitial lung disease, cystic fibrosis

indication.description: Administer to persons who have asthma.
Administer to persons with end stage renal disease.
indication.guidance: Includes dependence on hemodialysis or other renal replacement therapy

indication.description: Administer to persons who have severe B-lymphocyte (humoral) - antibody deficiencies (e.g., X-linked agammaglobulinemia and common variable immunodeficiency).
Administer to persons who have complete cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects (e.g., severe combined immunodeficiency [SCID] disease, complete DiGeorge syndrome).
Administer to persons who have partial cell-mediated or humoral T-lymphocyte defects (e.g., most patients with DiGeorge syndrome, Wiskott-Aldrich syndrome, ataxia- telangiectasia).

observationCode.text: Phagocytic function - Leukocyte adhesion defect, and myeloperoxidase deficiency

indication.description: Administer to persons who have a phagocytic function defect (e.g. leukocyte adhesion defect and myeloperoxidase deficiency).
Administer to persons who have HIV/AIDS and are severely immunocompromised [See the CDC general recommendations for a definition of "severely immunocompromised"].
Administer to persons who have received a solid organ transplant.

Administer to persons who are undergoing immunosuppressive therapy. Immunosuppressive medications include those given to prevent solid organ transplant rejection, human immune mediators like interleukins and colony-stimulating factors, immune modulators like levamisole and BCG bladder-tumor therapy, and medicines like tumor necrosis factor alpha inhibitors and anti-B cell antibodies.
indication.guidance: When immunocompromising therapy is being planned, vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before initiation or resumption of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons who are undergoing radiation therapy.
indication.guidance: When immunocompromising therapy is being planned, vaccination should be completed at least 2 weeks before initiation or resumption of therapy.

indication.description: Administer to persons receiving active treatment for solid tumors
Administer to persons receiving active treatment for hematologic malignancies
Administer to persons receiving CAR-T-cell therapy
Administer to persons with interstitial lung disease
indication.guidance: Having damaged or scarred lung tissue such as interstitial lung disease

indication.description: Administer to persons with cystic fibrosis
Administer to persons with thalassemia
Administer to persons with chronic obstructive pulmonary disease
Administer to persons with emphysema
Administer to persons with chronic cardiovascular disease.
indication.guidance: Includes heart failure, coronary artery disease, congenital heart disease, excluding isolated hypertension

observationCode.text: Diabetes mellitus complicated by chronic kidney disease

indication.description: Administer to persons diabetes mellitus complicated by chronic kidney disease
Administer to persons with severe obesity
Administer to persons with chronic hematologic disorders.
indication.guidance: Includes sickle cell disease and thalassemia.

indication.description: Administer to persons with sickle cell disease.

observationCode.text: Neurologic or neuromuscular conditions causing impaired airway clearance or respiratory muscle weakness

indication.description: Administer to persons with neurologic or neuromuscular conditions causing impaired airway clearance or respiratory muscle weakness
indication.guidance: Includes poststroke dysphagia, amyotrophic lateral sclerosis, muscular dystrophy; excluding history of stroke without impaired airway clearance

indication.description: Administer to persons who reside in a nursing home
Administer to persons who are frail
Administer to persons with diabetes mellitus complicated by neuropathy
Administer to persons with diabetes mellitus complicated by retinopathy

observationCode.text: Diabetes mellitus complicated by end-organ damage

indication.description: Administer to persons with diabetes mellitus complicated by end-organ damage
Administer to persons with diabetes requiring treatment with insulin

observationCode.text: Diabetes requiring treatment with sodium-glucose cotransporter-2 (SGLT2) inhibitor

indication.description: Administer to persons with diabetes requiring treatment with sodium-glucose cotransporter-2 (SGLT2) inhibitor
Administer to persons who have received a islet transplant.
